name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" is an undeniable cinematic masterpiece that flawlessly weaves a tale of power, family, and organized crime. Marlon Brando's iconic performance as Vito Corleone is nothing short of mesmerizing, while the film's intricate storytelling and compelling characters leave an indelible mark. Francis Ford Coppola's direction, coupled with a stellar cast, creates a timeless classic that transcends the crime genre. The meticulous attention to detail and a haunting musical score contribute to the film's enduring impact, making it a must-watch for any cinephile. Moreover, the film's portrayal of the mafia underworld is both gritty and authentic, painting a vivid picture of a world governed by its own set of rules!

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Based on Mario Puzo's novel, Francis Ford Coppola's epic crime classic The Godfather still stands as one of the finest and influential films of the 20th century. The Godfather features an all star cast with Marlon Brando headlining the movie and also starring Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Talia Shire, John Cazale and Diane Keaton.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: One moment stands out above all in THE GODFATHER (no not the horse's head). It is the slow zoom on Al Pacino when he is revealing his plan to kill Solazzo and the corrupt cop.  This is great characterization.  It shows Michael Corleone's development from a seemingly weak boy urging to forget his roots to a man ready to take the family helm. The Godfather is possibly the most brilliant film ever put on tape. Oscar winner Marlon Brando is great, but it is Pacino who steals the show in this one.  James Caan and Robert Duvall also offer up superb performances.  There are many other famous scenes in this one, including the infamous "baptism" scene. The Godfather is filmmaking at its finest.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: In writing an apology for a film that really needs none, let me begin by noting how many careers were established with this movie, beginning with that of Al Pacino. Pacino had made movies before and was a respected New York stage actor, but this was his breakthrough movie. Brando was regarded as poison: he was impossible to work with, causing movies to lose money with his outrageous demands, so the studio execs despised and distrusted him. This movie, for which he had to suffer the humiliation of auditioning, resurrected him. It opened the door to the memorable "Last Tango in Paris." Of course we had all seen Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, James Caan and John Cazale in other movies, but this one made them stars. (I don't recall seeing Talia Shire before this.) And it gave Coppola the kind of artistic freedom that would lead to "Godfather II"--another masterpiece. Puzo, who wrote the book and collaborated on the screenplay, would go on to do the scripts for "Superman" and other movies. It was magic for everyone who appeared in it. I am only sorry that the success it brought people like Marlon Brando and Richard Castellano led them to price themselves out of "Godfather II."

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: 1972's "The godfather", or to be more exact "Mario Puzo's The godfather", was based on his own book and adapted to screenplay by him and the director, Francis Ford Coppola. The movie stars Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton and many others and it received three Oscars for Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay and Best Actor for Brando which he infamously rejected as a protest directed against misrepresentation of Native Americans in the movies. It was a fine gesture by Marlon considering that I personally would call his character a supporting one and Pacino's Michael was the true lead but that's up for debate.

reviews: L Pacino was perfect for this film as well. What a way to start up your career. His character was all about depth and he displayed it perfectly. He was able to display his own inner-battles in his mind as well as the battles he had with his family, friends and enemies. His character was more of a psychological character study than anything else to me. Robert Duvall to me was the glue to the movie. He added a different perspective to everything in just that he was not Italian yet having the respect of the mafia. His character is a man of high authority within the Corleone family who was listened to and insightful;. This was simply perfect giving the film great balance throughout. The rest of the cast was just icing on the cake.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The best movie of all time, because it shows what true character development is in a movie. The character arch of Michael Corleone through the movies is one of the best ever written. It succeeds not only in pulling off the use of a classical/formal/mannered film language correctly and remarkably; that language is used to emotionally evoke a grand archetypal American narrative, Operatic and Tragic, built around an immigrant family, and charting its rise, corruption, and fall in ways that comment on a vast array of subjects that relate to the American condition: Marriage, Politics, Poverty, Crime, Innocence Lost, Violence, Loyalty, Betrayal, etc. etc. So: It's a classical tale told nearly perfectly; with rich, soulful acting, magnificent cinematography, and insinuating, meaningful dialogue.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Francis Ford Coppola's 'The Godfather' is perhaps the best gangster story ever told and the best film ever made. It's an enriching, engrossing, and evocative look into the criminal underworld in perspective of the Corleone family. This is also one of the rarest films to come out without any flaws. As far as it goes, The Godfather is literature for movie-goers and respectfulness for critics. It boasts legendary performances, excellent direction, a brilliant script, and a smooth, peaceful soundtrack.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I would like to know what happened to this film and why was it edited and not available in it,s original version any more.I know Coppola edited it for television around 1976 and the standard version that is available now is a very wimpy version of the film I saw in 1972 and a few more times in the mid seventies.First of all the sex scene between Sonny and Lucy actually showed some nudity,where in the current version it just shows the end part.All of the foul language is all edited or overdubbed,and the scene where Sonny is assassinated is missing some frames and is less violent than it,s original form.I am a big fan of James Can and the scene where he gets the news of his fathers shooting has been removed along with where he tells his mom about it.After he gets the phone call from Connie because Carlo beat her again it cuts the part out where Sonny comes storming out of the house using the four letter word three or four times.This is also missing.The Godfather (uncut) is the best film ever made and was James Caans most searing performance.I would like to know if I can find it anywhere as I have been searching for over twenty years now and am deeply saddened that such a fine movie was ruined.Help please.

reviews: I love this movie and all of the GF movies. I see something new every time I have seen it (countless, truly). name: Breaking Bad
reviews: There's no need to praise this movie anymore than it has been. Instead, I'd like to bring attention to the relevance it has to the crime genre. When we think of the 'tropes' of the organized crime genre in cinema, a lot of writers and directors pull from this movie franchise. I've even come across the tropes in the Godfather in foreign movies and series about organized crime.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a film that is critically acclaimed to the point of reverence, and rightfully so. The writing of the movie is absolutely brilliant, it takes its time setting things up and developing its characters so that events that occur later on have an amplified impact. The outstanding score by Nino Rota is incredible, it is no surprise how popular the soundtrack of this movie is. Marlon Brando gives one of the most impressive performances I have ever seen. His portrayal of Don Vito Corleone was genuinely awe-inspiring. This is thanks in no small part to the dialogue of the movie which is simply stellar. The movie is absolutely brimming with nuanced and poignant lines.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Francis Ford Coppola's The Godfather is not just a movie; it's an experience. Released in 1972, it's become synonymous with cinematic brilliance, captivating audiences for generations with its operatic story of family, loyalty, and the corrosive nature of power.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is so good because it is a masterpiece of a film that is held together firmly through a strong cast, world-changing cinematography, and the music that intensifies the strong theme presented in the film. Widely regarded as one of the greatest films of all time, this mob drama, based on Mario Puzo's novel of the same name, focuses on the powerful Italian-American crime family of Don Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando). The film follows Vito as he attempts to transfer his crime empire to his reluctant son, Michael. With some of the most graphic and gruesome death scenes to have ever been seen in the 1970's film industry (including a certain horse's head), 'The Godfather' epitomises how violence can be used effectively within a film.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Widely regarded as one of the greatest films of all time, this mob drama, based on Mario Puzo's novel of the same name, focuses on the powerful Italian-American crime family of Don Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando). When the don's youngest son, Michael (Al Pacino), reluctantly joins the Mafia, he becomes involved in the inevitable cycle of violence and betrayal. Although Michael tries to maintain a normal relationship with his wife, Kay (Diane Keaton), he is drawn deeper into the family business.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: .....for true cinema fans. I feel more like I'm just casting my vote to help keep this from being caught by "Shawshank Redemtion", which not only isn't even close to being the 2nd best film of all time (I was thinking more like "Casablanca, "Sunset Blvd.", "Gone With the Wind", etc...), but isn't close to being the best film of the 90's (Pulp Fiction, Schindler List)). the Godfather is the best film of the 1970's, which was itself a peak time for film creativity. the performances here are truly a shining example of the best in naturalistic acting. the cinematography is unsurpassed, with the dark lighting playing a key role. a lot of women mistake this for a "guy movie" or "male fantasy". maybe it is, but it isn't ONLY that. the choice we all face between our dual nature is fascinating and compelling.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" is truly one of THE greatest films in cinema ever.  With the help of possibly one of the greatest casts, Francis Coppola's film is one that should not be missed.  It all involves the rise and near fall of a mafia family.  Many of the young talents have gone to other great roles. Among them are Al Pacino(who steals the whole film), Robert Duvall, James Caan, Diane Keaton, and the late John Cazale.  And of course, there's Marlon Brando's performance as Don Vito Corleone.  He deserved the win for Best Actor, though it might have been a little dumb to refuse the Oscar.  Pacino should have been the real winner for the role of Michael.  With some of the greatest scenes ever this is a must see.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Coppola's 1972 film "The Godfather" is an unparalleled cinematic masterpiece. No other film to date has combined violence, romance and music so seamlessly. From the intertwining plot-lines to the flawless and complex character developments, everything about "the Godfather" was pure viewing magic. Never before, nor since, have I seen a film of such grandeur and class.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: As long as movies exist, The Godfather will always be relevant and stand out as one of the all time best.  When most people think of a perfect movie, this one comes to mind, and for good reason. Every single aspect of filmmaking is executed down to the finest detail with flawless results, most notably the violence, which is graphic but never gratuitous. The ensemble acting is arguably the best ever, with every performance being beliveable and memorable. The story of a mafia family trying to survive amidst a crumbling empire is very compelling, but it's much more than a mafia movie. It's a story about family and the importance of staying together.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I couldn't believe what people, critics, movie-sites are saying about it, cause I didn't think that one movie could have it all. But it had it, it deserved all what people was saying about and I am just proud to be writing a review on ;in my opinion, one of the greatest movies EVER made 'The Godfather'. What can I say...I never saw just a combination between action and drama in one movie, so I could say that the plot is definitely the best I've ever watched and may be will ever watch. Actors' performances were perfect, I mean what do you think of Al Pacino or even the better Marlon Brando's performance in any other movie? well, they were at their finest and reached their top acting talent in this movie. Also James Caan made a remarkable performance and especially that scene when he dies. Even the soundtrack and the main theme for the movie, I think nobody could ever forget this music and how it did fit the movie and the drama. By winning only 3 Oscars, I think that the academy awards really did underestimate 'The Godfather' as I believe that it deserves to be the most Oscar-winning movie in its year and may be one of the most ever....I just feel that whatever I'll say won't afford to describe such a legendary movie, but I must say that I recommend this to ANYONE who only wanna watch an excellent movie....

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is an extravaganza, nigh flawless, a cinematic magnum opus, ubiquitously acclaimed for its brilliance and for being in a league of its own. The Godfather doesn't depict poetic justice but rather portrays the triumph of perspicacious potency over abject vulnerability. The Godfather is known, not for its cogency but for its eloquence.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: At once an observant homage to crime films of the Thirties and Forties and a loving portrait of an Italian-American family, Francis Ford Coppola's adaptation of Mario Puzo's superlative novel (Puzo also co-write the script) is an achievement few films can hope to approximate. Coppola, along with his cinematographer, Gordon Willis, and his production designer, Dear Tavoularis, have created a history wholly realized, burnished brown as if a memory that will never completely fade. The world of the Cosa Nostra they present is closed and stuffy which provides an intimacy that generates an extraordinary amount of warmth and a feeling of lives being affected. The cast is flawless: the actors, to a person, inhabit the characters with such understanding and affection that they will be forever associated with them. (Al Pacino as Michael in the trilogy will never be able to match this work elsewhere.) But it is Marlon Brando in the title role that delivers such devastating work that you can only sit and stare in wonderment. Brando has a presence wise beyond his years and his gentle, thoughtful manner is never once betrayed his calculating, violent acts. Every movement, every vocal inflection is detailed and planned but he offers a spontaneity that never reveals technique. Guided by Coppola's abiding dedication to realism, Brando pushes this film to icon status. Not to be missed.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This is the one. The movie that sums perfection in 175 minutes. Just gets better every time I see it. Every bit of the film is precious and the movie's soundtrack is a classic. Just to hear the initial notes sends shivers down your spine. The conjunction of all this stars in one movies and the great performance given by each one of the actors is amazing. I love Brando's performance, and the way that Micheal Corleone's character is developing thru the film, Robert Duvall is great as Tom Hagen and James Caan as the hot-headed Santino opposite to everything that is Michael Corleone. All wrapped in a fine script written by Puzo which is really flawless. This is why I love movies.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: It could be argued that Francis Ford Coppola's film of Mario Puzo's bestseller, at once an art movie and a commercial blockbuster, marked the dawn of the age of the mega-movie.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The story views the Mafia from the inside. That is its secret, its charm, its spell; in a way, it has shaped the public perception of the Mafia ever since. The real world is replaced by an authoritarian patriarchy where power and justice flow from the Godfather, and the only villains are traitors. There is one commandment, spoken by Michael (Al Pacino): "Don't ever take sides against the family."

reviews: The central character(s) must undergo a transformation, resulting in them being almost unrecognizable by the end of the film. By putting them into situations, the character's character must not only influence the outcome of the situation; it must also have a lasting impact on the character. Consider Michael at the wedding and compare that to the Michael we see at the end of the film. Again, many films try, but most fail because they come up with unreal (literally, not promisingly) or simply moronic transformations (eg, Wall Street).

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I remember when I was about 13 when I first watched the Godfather. I turned it off after half an hour. Three years later one of my friends had it on video. At first I was reluctant to watch it, but I became entranced by what I saw. Not only did it contain probably the best ensemble cast I have ever seen(Brando, Pacino, Duvall, Caan, Keaton and Shire), but it is also one of the greatest stories in modern cinema. The predominant theme in this film is not violence or power as some might say it is, but family. Without giving the film away, the most moving and evocative parts of the film are when the members of the family are involved. I must admit I have not seen a great deal of Brando's work (Apart from 'Apocalypse Now'), but he deserved an Oscar here, for one of the greatest performances of our time. Caan, as the explosive 'Sonny' should have got 'Best Supporting Actor' too, as well as other magnificent performances by Pacino as Michael, and Duvall as Tom. Watch this film, you will NOT be disappointed. The greatest film ever? Probably-a definite 10.

reviews: This movie is so epic. One of the best movies in the universe, that's for sure, worth watching for everyone. The actors are great, casting is great and plot blows your mind. Unbelievable experience. It's amazing that 40 years later it still holds up. It brings out different emotions. And Al Pacino is a wonderful actor. The Godfather is fantastic from start to finish, there isn't a single second that felt off to me. It runs for almost 3 whole hours, and each second is utter perfection. It's a testament to the strength of the screenplay when you can sit in one spot and watch the film for twice the length of most feature films and be totally riveted and enthralled the whole time. This is a long, long movie, but not a single instant is wasted.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Fantastic movie. Incredibly rich storyline, repeat viewings reveal extra details that are echoed in the rest of the trilogy. Marlon Brando and Al Pacino usually receive all the plaudits but their fellow stars; James Caan, John Cazale and Robert Duval also shine. It's also a fascinating movie in way of transformations. Al Pacino starts out as a 'nice college boy' who refuses to become embroiled in the family business, only to become ensnared when an attempt is made on his father's life. Pacino's change in character is carried off with credibility, both physically and verbally. I have seen the trilogy numerous times but I still want to see more! Well done Mr Coppola!

name: Breaking Bad
reviews:
This movie was well directed with great acting and character development. There were many plot twists that kept me guessing and made me want to sit through the lengthy film. Although, there were a few confusing jumps in time that took away from the overall experience of the film. This film set the mold of what many crime dramas would later follow.
The film had great cinematography, using appropriate colors for each scene's tone. The film's score also resonated well with the scenes it was played in. The actors did a great job of immersing themselves in post-war mob culture while maintaining good chemistry with their co-stars. In conclusion, The Godfather is a film with excellent cinematography, acting, music, and plot.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Oh Hubris, hoisted by your own petard. Violence begets violence, Power corrupts, and absolute power corrupts absolutely. The first thing Michael says to Kay is Thats not me, thats my family. Oh self denial and delusion, of course thats Him too. Michael commits double murder to protect His father and His family. This leads indirectly to the murder of His brother Sonny, and His first wifes assasination, that was meant for Michael. This was the last straw in Michael's decent from innocence to degradation. His acceptance of violence to solve His problems is directly due to His fathers acceptance of violence, and ultimately His deception and lies lead Him to lose His second wife, Kay, the estrangement of His children, and to even killing his own brother, Fredo, the final decent into megalomania. This is what it all comes to. He loses everything that He loved, and wanted to save. This is one of the greatest films, a story very well told, and it's so sad! You cant turn away.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a 1972 American crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola, based on the novel of the same name by Mario Puzo. The film stars Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Richard S. Castellano, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden, John Marley, Richard Conte, and Diane Keaton. It follows the story of the Corleone family, a powerful Italian-American Mafia clan, as they struggle to maintain their control over their empire amid a series of violent conflicts.

reviews: Watching "The Godfather" for the first time was an experience that left me completely awed, amazed, and fascinated. It's not just a movie; it's an epic journey into the heart of a mafia family that holds power, loyalty, and a darkly woven fate. The rich storytelling, compelling characters, and the sheer depth of the narrative had a profound impact on me, drawing me into a world where honor and brutality coexist.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The film boasts an excellent script, superb direction, stunning cinematography, and a brilliant cast of actors who deliver unforgettable performances. The film explores the themes of loyalty, family, power, and morality in a realistic and nuanced way, showing the complex and often tragic consequences of the choices made by the characters. The film also features some of the most iconic scenes and dialogue in film history, such as the opening scene with Don Vito Corleone, the horse head in the bed, the restaurant assassination, and the final montage. The film is a must-watch for any film lover and a timeless classic that will never lose its appeal.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This movie is truly a masterpiece; the story is riveting, the momentum and pacing are marvellous, the characters are interesting and it really does pay off what it sets up, however, it would take me forever to recite the list of pros. I do have a few criticisms though; this movie, while leaving out some elements from the book were a good call(such as Fanucci and Johnny Fontain's full story), my sisters say that Vito's death isn't as tragic and Michael's arch isn't as slow burn in the film due to the decision to keep out some of the scenes relating to these 2 concepts, but I think that the scene before Vito's death was enough for the movie and the swiftness of Michael's development was justified, however, they should have ties up Fabrizio's sub-plot better. Overall, spectacular film.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I believe the Godfather is the greatest film all time. Marlon Brando, who at first wasn't interested to play Don Vito Corleone, put down his most stunning performance ever. The characteristics, the voice of Brando match perfect with the some kind of mysterious Vito Corleone. This film is also the real start of the career of Al Pacino. After he played Michael Corleone, he was immediately given the role of young cop Serpico one year later in 1973. The best actors of two following eras meet here in this film. But the Godfather is more than just Brando or Pacino. We must certainly not forget the brilliant performances by James Caan, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton, all Oscar nominated. John Cazale playing Fredo Corleone stays a bit in the background. I liked him better in part 2. Francis Ford Coppola puts all this great actors together in a beautiful whole.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This is, undoubtedly, THE classic movie of all time, and seems to set a standard for lines, effects, acting, action, and all other basic elements connected with any movie. With all due respects to the outstanding and late actor Marlon Brando, it was more than just he who made the movie an outstanding success, though he was convincing as the usually-calm yet almost-always cold, controlling don Vito Corleone The nostalgia effects were superb: it was not the least bit difficult to imagine what NYC was like between 1945 and 1955. (1971 NYC was "turned into" the NYC of the time setting of the story.) James Caan was as mean as mean could be in his role as the godfather Vito Corleone's son Santino, (Sonny) and Al Pacino, as the don's youngest and favorite son Michael Corleone, had his career launched in just this movie. Of course, Diane Keaton proved to be a promising future star in her role as Kay Adams at her young age of about twenty-five. The story came across as a story of, in my personal opinion, how NOT to live. (Of course, some would disagree with me one hundred per cent on that.) This in-depth study of the Mafia (though the word "mafia", as the case was supposed to be, was never used) was definitely a convincing view of the underworld with, among other things, the "eye-for-eye" mindset. To recapitulate, the nostalgia, the action, the acting, and the story itself made it THE great feat for Hollywood for all time. Paramount Studios, the director Francis Ford Coppola, and the producer Albert S. Ruddy should be proud.

name: Breaking Bad

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Heady, scalding adaptation of Mario Puzo's bestselling book about Italian Mafia family as seen through many years time. Flawless production design and palpably tense, prickly atmosphere are two of the picture's many riches, and indeed Marlon Brando's performance as the family patriarch is an incredible characterization, though several of the other characters don't always come off and the repellent violence is occasionally presented in a ham-fisted manner (with too much wicked glee behind the bloodshed). Francis Ford Coppola directed the proceedings like someone who has lived and breathed this material, and he doesn't allow his love for movie-making magic to cloud the realism of this family's dark dealings, but he perhaps allowed the cast too much free reign and some sequences tend to ramble. Won Oscars for Brando as Best Actor (he refused it), Coppola and Mario Puzo for their adapted screenplay and for Best Picture. Followed by two Coppola-directed sequels in 1974 and 1990.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather," directed by the visionary Francis Ford Coppola and based on the novel by Mario Puzo, is a cinematic triumph that continues to astonish and inspire viewers across the globe. Its narrative, grounded in the dark, complex world of the mafia, is a brilliant exploration of power, loyalty, and the inevitable transformation wrought by violence and ambition.

Worked with a very neat, solid storyline, the acting of great stars of the very characteristic makes the movie The Godfather became a box office of all time. Proved in the world movie database site IMDb, the film which has 3 sequel ranks 2nd as the top rated movie under the movie Shawshank Redemption. The Godfather is a portrait of a Mafia family in New York, played with remarkable by Marlon Brando and Al Pacino. If you ever watch this movie, I'm sure you'll agree with my review on these two Hollywood stars. Marlon Brando played Don Vito and Al-Pacino acted as his son named Michael. name: Breaking Bad
reviews: So if you asked me what was one of the best films of all time, guess what I would say? The Godfather! My experience with the godfather began all the way back when I was a little kid. I would watch scenes of this movie all the way from 9 years ago. The main reason I love this film, is because it managed to get a book with uncountable sub plots, and turn it into a film with only one plot, Michael's. The way the movie follows Michael, and shows his subtle change through ingenious imagery, and slow but interesting dialogue, into by the end of the film, the big man himself.And its not like Michael hogs the movie or anything, he allows space for Sonny and Vito to grow in, and even for minor characters to give outstanding jobs acting. Another thing, the acting. Oh my god, the acting in this film is phenomenally amazing! It shows you that you can get a bit of the character, dig a hole in it, pour a bit of yourself in to it, and you have yourself a great character, with you playing as it. God! What performances. Brando's performance as Vito, is a textbook case of too good an actor-itis. Not only does the film manage to get something classical like dialogue from the book, and add its own unique style of being calm, but yelling through the words you are saying. Also, the dialogue from this movie, is something so ahead of its time, -Sigh-it's so good. There is no real legitimate criticism I can give The Godfather, besides the fact that it took some sub plots and characters I loved from the book, and chopped them out of the film for a faster run time, which is fine, since the movie is like 4 hours long. I can't tell you much more about the film without giving it away, which would be really messed up as it is a must watch film. It's good. It's the pinnacle of cinema. The zenith of movies. Just watch it it's so great.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This movie is widely considered in the community of film critics to be a landmark in motion picture history and is rightfully so ranked up there with Citizen Kane and Casablanca as one the best movies in history. The lines are iconic, the scenes of family, betrayal and violence are all memorable, the performances are beyond Oscar worthy and it does what any great adaptation does; stay as faithful to the original as possible and only make changes whenever necessary. For me the most iconic scene is the baptism murders, which I felt are appropriately edited as Michael Corleone oversees the baptism of his infant son. The only minor nitpick I have is that, although Marlon Brando does give a solid performance, the look they gave him is a little too much like a geezer for me to believe he is a Mafia don. Nonetheless, this is a film that anyone taking a cinema class should watch.

Also, the story didn't show me the past of Vito Corleone, which I saw in The Godfather: Part II. The event of this movie was so slow and the story in some scenes becomes boring and not understandable. So, I give this Masterpiece (What people call it) 6.5 to 7 stars out of 10.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" (1972), directed by Francis Ford Coppola, is an undeniable masterpiece that stands the test of time. Set in the world of organized crime, this iconic film paints a compelling portrait of the Corleone family's rise and fall. Marlon Brando's mesmerizing performance as the powerful and enigmatic Don Vito Corleone anchors the narrative, while Al Pacino shines as his conflicted son, Michael. With its richly textured storytelling, impeccable cinematography, and a script that delves deep into themes of loyalty, family, and the corrupting nature of power, "The Godfather" captivates audiences from start to finish. Coppola's masterful direction and the stellar ensemble cast bring the characters and their intricate relationships to life, leaving an indelible mark on cinema history. A timeless classic that combines gripping drama, intense performances, and unforgettable dialogue, "The Godfather" remains an essential viewing experience for all film enthusiasts.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: It is always difficult to talk about classic and no doubt "The Godfather" is a classic, in fact, one of the greatest of all time. The film has a charm part, which are the details behind the scenes, over all star cast, the author of the script and clear about the director and screenwriter Francis Ford Coppola who is a legend! No doubt the best of the film is the direction, which is an exquisite class! With an absurd Coppola will calm counting frame by frame this story that could have been done in a hurry the basis of chases and shootouts endless. But on the contrary, with few action scenes, the director uses all his talent to focus on very rich scenes with good use of light, sound, photography, performances and spectacular dialogues, all working in harmony and building this history that is intertwined with the dirt permeating the mafia and at the same time love and loyalty that is due to the family.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is generally considered one of the greatest films of all time. In my opinion this stands, however it is nowhere near perfect. Most of the acting is very good, such as Marlon Brando's and Robert Duvall's performances, however Al Pacino's and Diane Keaton's performances are lacking. Talia Shire and James Caan give good performances, but not as remarkable as Brando's. The atmosphere of the movie is aided by the darkness in some of the settings, particularly those of the house. The film, on the other hand, is slightly too long . Some of the scenes could have been cut, and some sequences shortened, and the result would have been better. All in all this is a spectacular movie, which I urge you to see, but it is somewhat flawed.

reviews: This is my first review. It is an excellent and very well done movie There can be no mistake. When you watch The Godfather, you know you are watching something special. The Godfather has been showered with praise by nearly all major critics out there. This is one of my all time favorite. This movie stands at the top in all decades. "I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse."There are at least dozen movies (in my country alone) which inspired/copied this epic.So, the bottom line is if you haven't watched this yet then get a copy now.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews:
I had nothing to do on Sundays, and I found the godfather to pass the time.
And then still marveled. If it's true that there's one of the greatest movie openings of all time, this is the one.
Epic films like the godfather, with their huge story structure, their complicated relationships, and their many plot points, all need to be built up in the first act to lay a solid foundation for the rest of the narrative; In this limited time in the pursuit of infinite space, I think, as long as the relevant content can be put in all not bloated, is quite a realm; Can also be in a paragraph, comb the vein clear, simple and complex, only the great master can do.
Why did coppola keep so many relevant details in his hands?
After all, I thought he was telling a story.
To tell a story, to get rid of unnecessary technology, to tell a story in a down-to-earth way,
This kind of unpretentious, should also be one of the temperament that the epic pursues.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I was not a huge fan of old movies until I saw The Godfather. Before I saw it, I used to think that old movies were boring, and if it lasted more than 2 hours it would be even more. But then I decided to give it a chance, and now I consider myself kind of a fan of this trilogy. It talks about the story of Michael Corleone, who was the son of Vito Corleone, a respected leader of the Italian mafia in America and played a central role in the story. Most people think that it is just a mafia story, some even think that it focuses on drugs, but it really goes beyond just that, it is a story that shows us the development of Michael, a character who from the beginning seems to be in total disagreement with the family business, but the love he has for his father and the respect for him, transform him into the perfect successor, willing to change his principles in order to support his father and his family, since these are his main pillars.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: A True Master pieces from Francis Ford Coppola, and both Al Pacino and Marlon Brando were at their best in acting. Dialogue Delivery is very awesome, one can watch this movie n number of times and never get bored.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Big shout out to Flashback Cinemas for helping me finally, FINALLY, get this off my list of shame.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The godfather is cinema at its very best intriguing suspenseful and provoking, Francis ford Coppola manages to create a modern myth in the space of the course of the film surrounding the corleone family the main protagonist of the movie. The ageing don corleonie played eloquently by the late Marlon Brando refuses to enter into the narcotics trade following the end of ww2, following don Vito refusal this starts off a gang war between the 5 families of new york with the corleonies. The antagonist the barzini family and the tattalia family attemp to have don Vito character killed effectively castrating the corleones power. The attempt fails and Sonnie the dons eldest son takes control of the family while don Vito recovers meanwhile the dons youngest son Michael played by AL pacino agrees to kill the tattalia top narcotics distributor in a carefully orchestrated subterfuge at a peace negotiation. The death of the narcotic distributor escalates the war further leading to sonnies bloody execution at a toll booth one of the movies memorable scenes. Young Michael while in exile in Italy learns of his brothers misfortune and takes over following his fathers retirement, he vows revenge for his brothers murder. I will not give to much of the plot away but it is intriguing to see all the scheming and plotting by the mobsters. Both the camera work and lighting are superb and give a real atmospheric feel to the picture. This film is a must see for all film fans, rent it buy it now.

name: Breaking Bad

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This is the perfect example of how to transform a story from book to script to screen. No derail spared no character left unexplored and no thread of story left unanswered. All the cast performed magically and this is one of them rare occasions when a movie literally outdoes any review. Brando Pacino Duvall Caan all deliver performances of a life time and bring to the screen one of the most powerful portrayals of how the mob is a family and that family is Corleone.

reviews: Though staring a little slow, the movie was simply amazing. I sure wasn't any specific moment in the movie where I got excited except for the end. Anyways, the acting was a little too good to be true... the dialogues, the character developments all so good that modern cinema cant even touch it. One thing that stood most out of this movie was it's soundtrack, simply amazing. Cinematography and color designs of this movie are so damn good that we can see it even today - showing the color orange or even real oranges when a character is gonna die holds us the the entire movie, a true genius choice. The last scene of this movie where we see a character closing door on Michael's wife's face shows how he is getting disconnected from the family and when when Michael gets called "Don" seriously gave me goosebumps. I liked the movie good but i think that i am born in the wrong generation and in wrong time to truly feel what a beauty it is.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" (1972) is a cinematic masterpiece and is considered one of the greatest films in the history of cinema. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola and based on Mario Puzo's novel, the film presents an intriguing and profound narrative about an Italian-American crime family.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is one of those movies that could be considered perfect or near perfect. It's a perfect ten in just about every category of what makes a great film: Cinematography, story, character development, action sequences, acting, plot twists...this movie is an absolute masterpiece. There's no clich√©s or corny moments, no annoying, useless characters, and its about as original as it comes in all aspects of story. The Corleone family is both evil and moral, both sympathetic and begging for hatred, both understandable and from another world. Vito Corleone is a ruthless crime boss, but at the same time, has standards and a sense of right and wrong. Michael Corleone goes from being a war hero who claims that he is not his family, to a mafia don more ruthless than his father. Sonny, his older brother, is a loose cannon, but with method to his madness. Every time I watch this movie, I ask myself: How did Coppola and Puzo do it? How can this movie be described as anything except perfect? If I have ANY gripe with The Godfather, at the toll booth, there's no way that somebody could take that many rounds and still not be incapacitated. Yeah, people don't always drop with one round in real life, but fifteen guys opening up on full auto with .45 ACP rounds from a Tommy Gun is going to kill pretty damn quickly! But I'm a gun nut, so that's a nit pick. That, I guess knocks the Godfather down to about a 9.999999999999999999 out of 10!

reviews: Lets talks about the godfather. Now i know what everyone is thinking, 27 nominations and 23 was won. Very accomplished movie to say the least but that's not what makes it a great movie. Now i know about 90 percent of IMDb users will say " of course it's a great, what is there not to like about it. Well this movie does have a few flaws, not a lot but a few! But overall a fantastic piece of art. I've always wanted to create a movie that was visual as much as the godfather was or is. It really jumped Hollywood into a new era where mob movies were a thing and you could totally take risk with your story development and other things as well. I think it's fair to say that this movie has probably inspired a lot of directors in the film industry or better known as "Hollywood". I'm not a screen writer so don't get on me to bad for my spelling at times in this review.

Some people say that slow pacing is a drawback but for this film it's the total opposite. The pacing just really lets the audience feel apart of this family and like you are actually there on the dark paths that ensue my favourite example being the end shot of the door closing shutting out Kay and us, leaving you with a feeling of awe, intrigue and frustration as you want to see more of this world Coppola throws you in.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Once upon a time, in the suburbs of the Big Apple, there was a man named Vito Corleone who made his fortune selling olive oil. The Corleone family's olive oil business was top-notch, thanks to a combination of quality products and a unique customer appreciation campaign that included complimentary silencers and silk ties. With such marketing genius, it's no wonder they became the envy of their rivals.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The godfather tells a romantic gangster epic in a melancholy and calm style. It is one of the greatest gangster movies in the history of the film and is known as the bible of men. Not only has the film been successful in criticism, art and box office, but it has also set an example for future generations. It is a classic film praised by many people, and it has a good rating of up to 100 percent on authoritative film websites. The American Film Academy, an authoritative film organization in the United States, appraised it as "the greatest gangster classic film in the United States" and "godfather" has a profound influence on film history, gangster type films and popular culture. It is the best film in the film history in the hearts of many directors. The excellent interpretation of actors such as Malone Brando, Alpacio, Robert de Niro and so on, coupled with the historical poetical nature of the story itself, makes the film a masterpiece. "godfather", as a gangster film, is not nihilism to dilute the meaning of religion, on the contrary, this film has a deep Christian brand, it rarely discusses good and evil, and rarely uses subjective lens to express religious morality, but at several nodes, it focuses on the inner suffering of the characters and lightly expresses this connotation.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Vito Kliman: As an old generation godfather, Vito is the leader of the family and plays a vital role in the growth of everyone. In the opening study, he easily helps the Italian civilians around him solve problems. He teaches his godson Johnny to value his family and face problems like a man. He teaches Sonny to care more about his family and not to show his family's thoughts. He teaches Fred to participate more in family affairs. He has strong ability to solve problems and looks at the world with a long-term perspective. Although Vito is engaged in the gang industry, he still maintains his conscience and never participates in drugs. He clearly understands that if he participates in drug trafficking, all the forces behind him will draw a line with him. When Mike was in exile and Sonny was assassinated, he chose to meet with the heads of the five major families, giving up some of his interests in exchange for the other party's retaliation, and at the same time let Mike return to the country to take charge of the overall situation. This was the best solution at the time, retreating to advance and preserving the strength of the family. After that, the seriously injured old godfather Vito began to go behind the scenes and handed over the family business to Mike.

name: Breaking Bad

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is great. For almost thirty years now audiences have been captivated and intrigued by the Corleone family. And no other mafia movie has ever come as close to being this good. The story is just amazing and the directing by Francis Ford Coppola is nothing less than spectacular. Coppola has taken the concept of organized crime in America, something that was once looked down upon, and has built a cult following around it, with Marlon Brando and Al Pacino as their leading figures. And I don't think any single film has produced as many memorable scenes as The Godfather. Who could ever forget Marlon Brando, as Vito Corleone, buying those oranges on that fateful day? Or James Caan, as Sonny Corleone, getting massacred by the barrage of machine-gun bullets? And lines that will forever be repeated by fans like, "I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse." The bottom line is that The Godfather has changed the way we look and judge films. It has made cool what is sinful, crime a family value, and dynamic characters the modern-day icons of several generations of storytelling in film. Alongside all the revolutionary pictures of all time, The Godfather earns it place at the very top. Whether it is the #3 greatest film by the American Film Institute, #1 by IMDb, or #2 by me, this movie should very well be agreed by all to be a landmark in American film history.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is directed by Francis Ford Coppola, who co-wrote the screenplay with Mario Puzo and it's based on Puzo's best-selling novel of the same name. Why is this film regarded as a classic and of course among of the best films in history? It's an three hour ride of cinema of some of the finest written, finest acted, finest cinematography, finest editing, the remarkable musical score by Nino Rota and of course the brilliance that is Francis Ford Coppola. He created a masterpiece but bear in mind, though it is a movie everyone should watch, the slow pace and long length might turn some people off but if you bear with the slow pace then you will absolutely love the film. For being released in 1972 it was a very violent film. It's also full of symbolism which makes a second or third viewing so much more fun as there's so many details the director placed into its many scenes.

There was so many characters whom i did not like while reading the book but i loved it while watching the movie i saw it to late but if you have not seen it yet then you must watch it this will not waste your time instead you will learn a lot. The acting from everyone involved is great, Marlon Brando comes across perfectly as the head of the family, and James Caan and Al Pacino are excellent as his sons. The film is pretty shocking in the way every death occurs almost instantaneously, and as it spans ten years so many different things happen and every minute of it is great entertainment. reviews: This is probably one of the finest films I've ever seen.  Truly it's a classical masterpiece of cinematography and really gripping plot.  This movie not only launched the careers of the actors, but also affirmed the heavyweights as well.  It beautifully portrays the value of family, with romance, politics, and certainly blatant war. Yet, the movie is almost poetic, with violent scenes that don't drench you in gore, and a language that isn't in your face.  Simply put, it's what every great action/drama film should be.  A must-see for every true film goer.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" (1972) is a timeless classic that has left an indelible mark on the world of cinema. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola, this film is a masterful epic that explores the inner workings of a powerful Mafia family in New York City. The story is based on the novel of the same name by Mario Puzo and follows the aging patriarch of the Corleone family, Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando), as he tries to maintain his power and protect his family from the various threats that come their way.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: If you ever had to choose a movie for any positive reason whatsoever, choose this movie. This movie is something that is a guaranteed must see before you die. One of the GOATs.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This film works so well because it takes place in an underworld in which we are so embedded that we do not even observe it. Coppola puts us straight in the smack-dab center of what is, admittedly, a society made by criminals for criminals. It is also the reason why it's so welcoming. We are surrounded by its inhabitants--cold-blooded murderers, men who see crime like a 9 to 5 job masquerading as honorable men. And I do mean men. From the outside, we would only witness the horrifying, disturbing manifestations of their well-thought out actions

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I recently had the pleasure of re-watching the timeless classic, "The Godfather," directed by Francis Ford Coppola and based on the novel by Mario Puzo. This masterpiece, released in 1972, tells the gripping story of the Corleone family, a powerful Italian-American Mafia clan, and their struggle to maintain power amidst rivalries and crime.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: As a classic film, "The Godfather" is perfect in storytelling, performance, photography, and movie skills, and can be used as a textbook for movies. As an epic film, the whole story has a huge pattern, a complicated plot, and many characters. There are more than 20 characters who need to be expressed, but the film handles them in an orderly manner. Under Coppola's superb director skills, the characters are distinct in primary and secondary, and the character is full. Some characters only need one lens and one detail to express the character's character.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a must watch. The acting is outstanding, bringing to life characters that are rich and complex, perhaps unlikeable at first but as you get to know them you warm to them. This a film where all actors are in rare form in an ensemble cast, Marlon Brando is brilliant as Don Vito, very heavily disguised yet stately. Al Pacino did a truly wonderful job carrying the film, while James Caan is dignified and loyal, Diane Keaton beautiful and alluring and Robert Duvall nicely understated. Other outstanding assets are the masterly direction from Francis Ford Coppola, and the brilliantly written screenplay that is intelligent, thought-provoking and darkly humorous. As for the violence, some of it is shocking and intense especially in the climax which was enough to almost make your heart either beat twice as fast or stop.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: When somebody approaches a screening of The Godfather, there is naturally going to be a bit of nervousness approaching it, since so many people have called one of the greatest films of all-time. There is a feeling that he will come away with comments like "It wasn't that great." or "That's supposed to be brilliant masterpiece." Well, I am going to add some more into the hype machine, because the many other raves about The Godfather are true. It is a phenomenal motion picture that deserves its awards, praise and even more. Francis Ford Coppola constructed one of the shining works of the New Hollywood Era and due to the many spoofs that people produce, both in films, television and YouTube, it has stayed in the memories of countless film lovers. Much like Citizen Kane and Casablanca, a viewing of The Godfather is a must for any film aficionado.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The work changes the audience's perception of crime movies, especially the gangster series. Before that, the term "mafia" was unfamiliar to Hollywood. Crime themes often revolve around murders and detective investigations that end with evil being brought to light. From 1930 to 1968, Will Hays - the late president of the MPAA (American Motion Picture Association) - applied Hays law, requiring movies not to depict in detail criminal acts such as murder, theft, robbery, etc. The director must not tell a crime story with a point of view that empathizes with or inspires imitations.

reviews: I have watched it more than six times and every time I watch it I discover that it is more beautiful than before. Every aspect of this movie is really wonderful. I can say it is one of the masterpieces in the history of film making. To me it is the number one movie of all times. Marlon Brando was marvelous. Al Pacino was adorable. James Caan was great. Robert Duval was really great. It is really hard to tell what is missing in this movie. The whole package was really astonishing. I have never imagined a movie will have such an impact on me as well as on many others. I have watched it with my brothers a couple of years ago. You won't believe it if I tell you that every year I go to a movie store and rent it again. I will be doing this for the rest of my life because it is an artistic piece that is worth watching more and more. In conclusion, I would like to say that if Marlon Brando had not been there, this movie would have lost a lot of its glimmering and shimmering light. Al Pacino was also as outstanding as Marlon Brando. The movie is a way beyond criticism. It is a work of art for all generations and at all times. Also the story itself is well-knit that you feel it happened in reality. There are lots of movies out there, but they never measure up to the God Fahter.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Francis Ford Coppola's classic landmark crime epic is one of the finest most riveting American films ever made. It is based upon Mario Puzo's best selling novel of the same name. Set in 1945 on Long Island it tells the tale of the most powerful Mafia family dynasty in America, which is led by the aging Don Vito Corleone, sensationally played by the late great Marlon Brando, who made a phenomenal career comeback with this brilliant Oscar winning performance. His youngest son Michael, played marvelously by Al Pacino in his breakout Oscar nominated performance, has just returned from serving with the Marines in World War II, and is attending the wedding of his beloved sister Connie, played wonderfully by Talia Shire. The joyful family occasion is short lived because of a ruthless drug dealer named Virgil Sollozzo, impressively played by the late great character actor Al Lettieri, who is looking for financial support as well as protection from the Corleone family. But when Don Vito refuses and turns down Sollozzo's request, he tries to have Don Vito assassinated by two hit men who gun him down outside a fruit stand, but Don survives the hit barely. This will set in motion a series of deadly events into play and a full scale Mob war will begin. Magnificent direction by Coppola, with impeccable supporting performances by James Caan, Robert Duvall, Richard Castellano, Sterling Hayden, John Marley, Richard Conte, Diane Keaton, and Abe Vigoda. Breathtakingly filmed with beautiful on location sequences shot in Sicily by the late great master cinematographer Gordon Willis, Nino Rota's unforgettable musical score is powerfully haunting. This is one of the few rare times where the film is better than the book. "The Godfather" is a history-making cinematic masterpiece that is the winner of three Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Actor: Marlon Brando, and Screenplay: Francis Ford Coppola and Mario Puzo.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Epic in scope while maintaining a patience and intimacy characteristic of European art cinema, THE GODFATHER is rightly considered one of the greatest films ever made. The Godfather continues to influence producers of films, television shows, and video games more than 30 years after its release. Nino Rota's score, the sumptuous set design, and Brando's raspy pseudo-whisper have become part of our collective cultural memory.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews:
When a movie isn't called one of the greatest of all time, then high expectations are bound to come. Sadly, this means some people will be disappointed. I've felt the same way about Dr. Strangelove and Back to the Future. So every movie has naysayers, just how it is. But I am always astoundes when I hear someone does not like The Godfather. 
It really is the closet thing to a perfect film that I have ever seen. From the story, the production, direction, and of course, the acting. Brando puts on his greatest performance. Pachino, Duvall, Keaton and Caan also put on extraordinary performances. The movie is long but never boring. It always manages to keep you interested even in the more slow parts. That is good filmmaking.

reviews: Watching The Godfather is a requirement for Human Citizenship. The GodFather is not a movie but more a pillar to understanding the human race. I am going to keep this review short and sweet.. Don't watch the GodFather, but embrace the jewels of life it offers and it will teach you life lessons beyond what you can imagine. <<<---This was what I wrote before IMDb prompted me that my review does not contain enough lines and I need at least 10 lines of text. I will take this opportunity to commend the perfect selection of the cast and crew. Usually, every movie I watch there is ALWAYS some sort of comment or critique I add within the first 30 minutes of the movie. The Godfather & Braveheart are the only two films that I have not had a critique for which still boggles me to this day. The Godfather is the only movie that I could watch over and over and will continue to watch over and over throughout my life, and not get bored even just a little to say the least. name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a 2006 open world action-adventure video game developed by EA Redwood Shores and published by Electronic Arts. Originally released in March 2006 for the PlayStation 2, Xbox and Microsoft Windows, it was later released for the PlayStation Portable as The Godfather: Mob Wars, Xbox 360 as The Godfather: The Game, Wii as The Godfather: Blackhand Edition, and PlayStation 3 as The Godfather: The Don's Edition.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: It would be easy to name a solid handful of decent Mafia movies but this is without doubt the Godfather of them all, A family tree through the ages vying for control of the crime family network. This epic story will span over a trilogy from the turn of the century to the late 70s and centres in on Michael Corleone the unsuspecting heir to a legacy left vacant by Vito Corleone The Godfather. Enemies , friends , family , authorities , who can you trust in a cesspool of corruption , deceit , murder and politics , Michaels path is laid out for him and its obvious the apron strings cant be cut no matter his reluctance no matter his refusal , when it comes to family you need to take your place at the table especially this family. World class Script , Direction , and Acting , BRANDO , PACINO & DENIRO swim in these rolls as the heads of the Corleone crime family and a legacy is born with an untouched masterpiece...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I went into this movie with the mindset of this will be overrated. After watching, Goodfellas, The Departed, and The Irishman, I expected The Godfather would be the same. All I expected from it was to be the first best mob movie, which set the trend of all other mob movies. As I started watching it, I quickly realized it isn't like the other mob movies. It is better. It has more of a story and character development. The Godfather is one of the best mob movies ever, with an actual story and character development. The acting is impressive, and the story is even better. This is 100% a must-watch if you are into mob movies or classic movies.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a 1972 American crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Albert S. Ruddy, based on Mario Puzo's best- selling novel of the same name. It stars Marlon Brando and Al Pacino as the leaders of a fictional New York crime family. The story, spanning 1945 to 1955, chronicles the family under the patriarch Vito Corleone, focusing on the transformation of Michael Corleone (Pacino) from reluctant family outsider to ruthless mafia boss.

name: Breaking Bad

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: At its heart, "The Shawshank Redemption" is a story of perseverance and the indomitable power of the human spirit. Through Andy's meticulous planning and unwavering resolve, the film delivers a powerful message about the importance of holding onto hope even in the darkest of times.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Best movie which has good number of actors dedicated to their role."The Godfather," directed by Francis Ford Coppola and based on Mario Puzo's novel of the same name, stands as a monumental masterpiece in the landscape of American cinema. This epic crime film, released in 1972, weaves the tale of the powerful Corleone mafia family, with a focus on the transformation of Michael Corleone, played with unparalleled depth by Al Pacino, from reluctant outsider to ruthless mafia boss."The Godfather" is not just a film about the mafia; it is a story about America, about the immigrant experience, and about the dark underbelly of the American Dream. It challenges the viewer to contemplate the price of loyalty, the bonds of family, and the cyclical nature of power and violence.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Mario Puzo's novel about crime, corruption, family and loyalty comes to life with the help of Francis Ford Coppola in The Godfather. The Corleone family, headed by the aging Vito Corleone, is the most powerful family on the East coast, and possibly all of America. They "own" senators, judges and policemen. They are above the law. Vito's son, Michael, has just returned from the war a hero, and wants no part in the family business. But when an up and coming rival family wanting to get into the drug trade asks the Corleones for protection, Don Vito declines their offer, sticking to his traditional Sicilian values. The other families aren't as concerned about the old ways and want in, but know that they can't do business without the Corleones' influence. So, they have Don Corleone shot, expecting to gain leverage with the Don out of action. Luckily, the Don survives and Michael, furious with the attempt on his father's life, steps up to take out the opposition.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather" is a classic crime drama film directed by Francis Ford Coppola and released in 1972. Starring Marlon Brando and Al Pacino, the film tells the story of the powerful and influential Corleone crime family in New York City. The film is known for its outstanding performances, particularly Brando's portrayal of the family's patriarch, Vito Corleone. The story follows the rise of the younger Corleone son, Michael, as he takes over the family business after his father is brutally murdered. "The Godfather" is a masterfully crafted film that explores themes of loyalty, power, and family dynamics in a way that remains timeless and relevant. The film received widespread critical acclaim upon its release and has since become a cultural phenomenon, influencing countless other films and media.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a movie that has truly earned its place in cinematic history. The film is an expertly crafted exploration of the world of organized crime, showcasing the gritty realities of this violent and dangerous world while also delving into the complex relationships between the characters. The acting is top-notch, with Marlon Brando's performance as Vito Corleone and Al Pacino's portrayal of Michael Corleone being particularly memorable. The film's pacing is slow and deliberate, allowing the audience to fully immerse themselves in the story and the characters. The music, cinematography, and direction are all masterful, making "The Godfather" a movie that is both emotionally intense and intellectually stimulating. In my opinion, this is a film that every cinema lover should experience at least once in their lifetime.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I honestly think this is the finest piece of cinema I have every viewed (but then again, I can't claim to have seen vast quantities of movies). Firstly, the aesthetics mark it out as a classic: some shots, such as those of Vito Corleone in his study, could be removed from the film and considered art by themselves. Not only are the costumes beautiful, the lighting, sets and movement makes the film absolutely stunning, visually. All scenes appear to have a mild sepia tint and the lights particularly focus our eyes on peoples' expressions.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Science fiction has been used as an indication of what the future may hold. At times, it was promising a utopian future, where scientific inventions and developments will make life so much better for "humans", and machines (robots or, more generally, artificial intelligence) will be doing all the hard work. In other cases, however, it held a dystopian future, a warning message: technology can, and will, go wrong, and it will backfire, making our future full of destruction and agony.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is a classic and easily one of the best crime films ever released. It boasts a colorful host of characters, amazing plot twists within its sprawling storyline and impressive cinematography. The movie is a true epic that can stand the test of time. The success of "The Godfather" as a novel was largely due to a series of unforgettable scenes. Puzo is a good storyteller, but no great shakes as a writer. The movie gives almost everything in the novel except the gynecological repair job.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" is a timeless classic in the world of cinema. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola and released in 1972, the film is widely considered as one of the greatest films of all time. The story follows the Corleone family, a powerful Mafia family in New York, as they navigate through the treacherous waters of organized crime. The film boasts an all-star cast, with Marlon Brando delivering a career-defining performance as the head of the family, Vito Corleone. The film is not just a gangster movie, but a timeless tale of family, loyalty, and the price of power. The cinematography, the musical score, and the screenplay are all masterful, elevating the film to a level of artistry. Whether you are a fan of the genre or not, "The Godfather" is a must-watch for anyone who appreciates cinema.

name: Breaking Bad

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The execution of the 5 family heads is one of the most powerful scenes not only in this trilogy, but of all film. You have Michael swearing to renounce Satan in the church while his minions are slaughtering men on the street, under his orders.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The key to the success of this defining gangster movie is the faultless casting. All the characters are strong and eminently believable. The central masterpiece is, of course, Brando's Don Corleone, a feudal mafia warlord of the old school who can distribute largess or initiate mayhem with no more than a mumbled whisper to his ever-attentive mobster acolytes. Excellent performances from Al Pacino , James Caan, and Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden as the tough, bad cop and one of my favorite screen thugs, Al Lettieri as "The Turk" Solozzo. A fairly predictable plot, even if you haven't first read the book , but so what? Its not meant to be a mystery. We the audience KNOW that the enemies of the family are going to get what's coming to them by way of the usual methods, and the director does not disappoint us. The traditional christening juxtaposed with the scenes of vengeful carnage are a masterful touch.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This movie balances humanity, drama, and classic mafia violence in spades. The death of Sonny stands out as one of the most iconic moments from the movie with graphic violence and zero restraint. The Godfather also deals with the struggle of a man who tries to do good but has to deal with the pressure of his family. This movie balances the style of a gangster movie with the substance of a carefully crafted story.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather, an American gangster epic film, released in 1972, was adapted from the 1969 best-selling novel by Mario Puzo and has been regarded as a masterpiece since its release. This movie performance is very well.

reviews: "The Godfather," directed by Francis Ford Coppola and released in 1972, is a timeless masterpiece that has stood the test of time. name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The opening marriage scene is incredible. It is not rushed, it takes at least 20-30 min and it develops the characters so well. You are immediately immersed in Don Corleone's world. It's beautiful to watch this film build anticipation through engaging discussions between characters and not a bunch of action. This builds excitement that climaxes in the restaurant murder scene. The cinematography is incredible. You feel a part of the scene. Several characters are defined and developed throughout the film. One of the best movies of all time.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The scale of achievement is such that it not only defined the image of gangster culture in the popular consciousness but also influenced real gangsters and mafiosi to imitate the film's characters in style and manner of speech. Francis Ford Coppola admitted that he did very little actual research into the gangster culture and that to him the film was a stylistic "modern myth" about the Italian-American immigration experience.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Classics can be seen as old, intimidating, mostly black and white movies... The Godfather doesn't even glimpse at those characteristics, in contrast, it not only enthralls the audience, but also inspires other films relating to its topic.  The 1940s revolved around a tone that was dark, and uninviting to sympathy, while The Godfather actually triggers extreme emotion towards the, otherwise seen as, "bad guys."

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: The Godfather is probably the most well crafted film ever made. No true fan of film will deny this piece of art. Marlon Brando and Al Pacino turn in amazing performances. James Caan and Robert Duvall are equally brilliant. The cinematography is among the best I've seen and the lighting is nearly perfect.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: In 1945, at his daughter Connie's wedding to Carlo Rizzi, Don Vito Corleone hears requests in his role as head of a New York crime family. His youngest son, Michael, who was a Marine during World War II, introduces his girlfriend, Kay Adams, to his family at the reception. Johnny Fontane, a famous singer and Vito's godson, seeks Vito's help in securing a movie role; Vito dispatches his consigliere, Tom Hagen, to Los Angeles to persuade studio head Jack Woltz to give Johnny the part. Woltz refuses until he wakes up in bed with the severed head of his prized stallion.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: Wow! When I came out the Godfather for the first time that was first thing I said, wow. I guess that one word can mean a lot of things but to me it was just short for 'this movie is amazing and I've never seen anything like it ever and I'm glad I can say that i've watched it'. The problem was, the first time I watched it, I had to asked my dad half the time what the hec these guys were talking about or who was killing who'. But the second time I watched it, I understood every word and really got into it. Cause, it's a classic and I'm that kind of person who loves to watch some of those great old films like On the Waterfront or the French Connection. And the The Godfather wasn't like any of them. The story was amazing and god forbid the fantastic dialogue but I think that the film's strong point is the acting. Well, when you've got Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, Diane Keaton and Robert Duvall attached to a movie then you kind of already know it's gonna be amazing. And it was. Marlon Brando really deserved his Oscar for playing the extremely iconic role of Vito Corleone and Al Pacino, Robert Duvall and James Caan all deserved there nominations as well. Personally, I don't think there's anything really wrong with this film. The cinematography is wonderful, I've mentioned the acting and the writing, the costumes are superb and the violence is as brutal as it is compelling. If you have the time, then watch this masterpiece.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: This movie may have comes out 25 years before i was born, but recently my mom came home with the 40th anniversary edition. I just finished watching the first and second film, they are amazing i just can't stop talking about them. I love the power games there is between everyone. Im not much for gangster or action films, but this really got to me. It was amazing to watch it on blue ray the light was perfect. I enjoyed every little part of this film, and didn't seem to noticed it lasted almost 3 hours. I don't ever write reviews but this was a film i think everyone should watch, its a timeless masterpiece which I'm sure would could be enjoyed by many in my generation. And the acting is superb, but Al never seems to disappoint me.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: "The Godfather" is not only the greatest crime drama ever made, it is true perfection in every cinematic aspect. Coppola's directing is flawless, the performances and casting could not have been better, and the story based on Mario Puzo's novel is incredible in its intricate portrayal of a number of years during the twilight reign of an aging mafia Don, as he begins to disassemble his leadership over the family's business affairs and hand them over to his sons in the midst of an all-out war between New York City's Mafia families.

name: Breaking Bad
reviews: I have seen many films far more ambitious in their scope and execution, I have seen more than a dozen films that made far more important statements about the world, and I have seen films that moved me far beyond anywhere The Godfather could have moved me.  But can the greatness of this film really be denied by anyone with even a vague knowledge about the filmmaking process? To call this film garbage is idiocy, there is no excuse, anyone who might make such a statement obviously has no clue about movies, even if they try to state otherwise.  Despite the fact that in many ways it glamorizes the criminal life, The Godfather is the peek of excellence in film.  It's a shame that people buy into the gangster formula created by Hollywood, it's a worse shame that people expect it, and when they do not see it they demand it!  This film breaks out of the formula, and it does so shamelessly, but it doesn't do it thoughtlessly.  There are truly excellent ironic statements all throughout the film, it surprises me that some people who claim to have some knowledge about film miss them.  The baptism that Michael Corleone attends is just one example, the shots of the baptism are juxtaposed with intercut shots of brutal killings taking place at approximately the same time, killings that were ordered by Michael as he took over the "family business".  It's a very powerful scene, almost revolting, it creates a very definite question mark as to the glamorous nature of the first part of the film.  Once again, this is far from the greatest film, but it's a definite 10 - there is no question about it.

reviews: In 1972, one based on a bestselling film written by Mario Puzo emerged. The saga of the Corleone family is like a tragic opera, soaked in blood and deafened by the noise of the guns. The shooting marked by disagreements between the director and producers. A film that addresses violence, mafia, family and love. Yes, the love a father has for his family. Cynical characters under a humanized view maintains the essence of the work, no one is who is by chance, are the circumstances that define their choices, all for a greater good: the good of the family. A metaphor for America in the history of The Godfather is clear from the first moment, Francis Ford Coppola holds a dramatic power of passages of the book by Mario Puzo turning a great book into a powerful film, both in its aesthetics and in its essence. The Godfather is my favorite movie, and undoubtedly one of the most important films in history. The most talked about, imitated and revered film.
